Package snakes_and_ladders

Class LadderAndSnake

java.lang.Object
snakes_and_ladders.LadderAndSnake
public class LadderAndSnake extends Object
Represents an instance of the game itself with all its core mechanics.

    getPlayers()
    Basic getter for players attribute.
    private void
    newTurn(Player player)
    The turn is divided into 4 steps:
    - Throwing the dice; incrementing player's location and saving as a preliminary location.
    - Checking if the new location is bigger than the end location, and recalculating user's location if it's the case.
    - Checking if there are any snakes or ladders at the new location and recalculating user's location.
    - Checking if there is a collision with another player and throwing that other player outside the board (location 0).
    void
    play()
    Core method of the game instance responsible for executing the game and going through all the steps until a winner is determined.
    private void
    printBoard()
    Prints out board layout and the players at their locations.

  • Field Details

    • number_of_players

      private int number_of_players
      Holds the number of players playing the game.

    • gameboard

      private static Gameboard gameboard
      Holds the Gameboard object representing the board and its features.

    • players

      private Player[] players
      Holds the Player objects. The sequence of players determines the turn sequence as well.

  • Constructor Details

    • LadderAndSnake

      public LadderAndSnake(int number_of_players)
      Creates an instance of the game with the passed number of players. Also validates the number of players that was passed. Only exactly 2 players are allowed. If number passed is lower than 2 the game will terminate. If number is greater it will be reset to 2.
      Parameters:
      number_of_players - participating in the match.

  • Method Details

    • flipDice

      private static int flipDice()
      Generates a random integer from 1 to 6 representing a dice value.
      Returns:
      integer from 1 to 6.

    • getFirstPlayerIndex

      private int getFirstPlayerIndex()
      Decides the first player by throwing the dice and picking the player who got the greatest value.
      Returns:
      the index of the player from the players array that will start its turn first.

    • getPlayerAtLocation

      private Player getPlayerAtLocation(int location)
      Returns the Player object at a given board location.
      Parameters:
      location - on the board from 1 to 100.
      Returns:
      a Player object.

    • newTurn

      private void newTurn(Player player)
      The turn is divided into 4 steps:
      - Throwing the dice; incrementing player's location and saving as a preliminary location.
      - Checking if the new location is bigger than the end location, and recalculating user's location if it's the case.
      - Checking if there are any snakes or ladders at the new location and recalculating user's location.
      - Checking if there is a collision with another player and throwing that other player outside the board (location 0).
      Parameters:
      player - whose turn has to be played out.

    • getBoardLocation

      private int getBoardLocation(int board_row_index, int board_column_index)
      Calculates the corresponding location on the board given a pair of row and column indexes in the board array. Location numbers go from left to right (ascending) for even row indexes, and from right to left (descending) for the odd rows.
      Parameters:
      board_row_index - in the board array.
      board_column_index - in the board array.
      Returns:
      corresponding location on the board from 1 to 100.

    • printBoard

      private void printBoard()
      Prints out board layout and the players at their locations.

    • play

      public void play()
      Core method of the game instance responsible for executing the game and going through all the steps until a winner is determined.

    • getNumberOfPlayers

      public int getNumberOfPlayers()
      Returns the number of players participating in the game.
      Returns:
      the number of players.

    • getGameboard

      public static Gameboard getGameboard()
      Basic getter for gameboard attribute.
      Returns:
      Gameboard object.

    • getPlayers

      public Player[] getPlayers()
      Basic getter for players attribute.
      Returns:
      players array.
